alert.note: Alert for Lyon; Mineral (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 5:59PM PDT until July 19 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Nevada, including the following counties, Lyon and Mineral. * WHEN...Until 800 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in streams, low-lying, and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 558 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cottonwood Creek, East Walker River and Rattlesnake Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southern Lyon and Western Mineral Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
